lead_paragraph: There has been no news from Li Xin since Jan. 11, and his wife and others fear that Thai officials secretly turned him over to the Chinese authorities.

byline.contributor: Chris Buckley reported from Beijing, and Thomas Fuller from Bangkok. Ellen Barry contributed reporting from New Delhi, and Adam Wu contributed research from Beijing.
byline.original: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and THOMAS FULLER

headline.print_headline: Disappearance of Chinese Journalist May Signal Thailand’s Shift Toward Beijing
headline.main: Chinese Journalist Seeking Refuge in Thailand Disappears

snippet: There has been no news from Li Xin since Jan. 11, and his wife and others fear that Thai officials secretly turned him over to the Chinese authorities.
abstract: Wife and supporters of dissident Chinese journalist Li Xin, who disappeared while traveling through Thailand, fear Thai authorities returned him to China; experts suggest series of recent renditions of asylum seekers, besides being violation of international law, reflects Thai regime's desire to curry economic and political favor with China.
